alert.note: Alert for Coke; Runnels; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 10:02PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Coke, northeastern Tom Green and southwestern Runnels Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1002 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ballinger Lake to near Miles to near Orient to near Grape Creek. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ballinger, Maverick, Orient, Tennyson, Rowena, The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662 and Ballinger Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
